pABR6AjZjMV__uz7gFbOUw.text: As someone who is constantly on the hunt for good, authentic tacos, this place has certainly made the cut. Some of the best tacos Ive had [in Charlotte]. I also tried their horchata and it was quite "chalky". Not in an authentic, residual rice way but in a last glass at bottom of a carton way.

Iz-IFSmR8xSTyXQdKBBlpQ.text: Best tacos in town. Great service and nice folks. I do my best to speak the small amount of Spanish I know here and they are very accommodating to two gringos every time I visit. Cervesa Victoria y dos tacos Dr tripa.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States

j6I2Yyg9Jgf7eyTYbEaYOw.text: Nice little place, tacos got great flavor along with the salsas, not too much meat on them though. Delicious!

_gonZsSXEVLDou17A1RdBA.text: I liked this a lot. Several of my close friends are from Mexico, so I'm used to the food their mothers made for us when we were young. This is the closest I've found in Charlotte. The agua de tamarindo is sweeter and less tart than I'm used to, but the salsas and the tacos were dead on. If your Spanish, like mine, is the teensiest bit rusty, there's a little bit of a language barrier, but they're super patient about it.

PGiguirzWuyu-IeONyR2Xw.text: Im so glad we decided to try this place.  Looks like a hole in the wall but dang!!! Yummy! Pollo and pastor tacos are soooo good!  Price can't be beat.  I'll be back.

udoSAEd4qArfoow72f_MlA.text: Wish I could give this place NEGATIVE stars. First off, I love tacos and USED to love this place but just today, I went back after some time of not going and was expecting A1 tacos like usual but this time I ordered 3 tacos, 1 steak, 1 Chorizo (Mexican sausage), and 1 Pastor (Pork) .. well they brought out the tacos and ended up giving me Steak and 2 tacos that did not look like Chorizo or Pastor. One looked like tofu and one was some kind of soggy greasy meat. I had them take it back, because that's NOT what I ordered and they took it back and made "new" ones.. when I received my "new" tacos they weren't new at all. IT WAS THE SAME PLATE. So, I told them I didn't want these tacos because they weren't good and I was a regular customer and they NEVER looked this way. After 20 minutes of arguing with the waitress that I wouldn't pay for these nasty tacos that I -DIDN'T EVEN TOUCH- she called the Owner over the phone.. which I was happy thinking the owner would accommodate me, well the owner was WORSE than the waitress and said that the meat is fine and no one has complained and that I had to pay for these tacos. I told her fine, I would pay but IM NEVER GOING BACK. She said she would cut the Taco price in half but why would I pay for tacos I didn't even eat? They're full of B.S. and a huge disappointment. STAY AS FAR AS YOU CAN FROM THIS PLACE!! What was once my favorite Taco spot is now a crap hole with rude employees. Moral of the story is they DO NOT CARE FOR THEIR CUSTOMERS AT ALL. They were more interested in making me pay $6 then my loyalty as a customer. HATE THIS PLACE. NEVER GOING BACK.

qCUCXZfE5Xu_MsOooXL3-g.text: Rico! Besides the wait (which k get because the food is great) there's nothing wrong with this place, there's always a line coming out the door and the tables always full because the tacos, tortas and quesadillas are that good! Authentic tasty food.

XRj7wddpJQqv_k0nhDdyzA.text: Absolutely horrible ! Don't waste your time here . Service is horrible .. waited over 30 minutes for food .

vTvOYdEvs-jXJbQRNgMyOQ.text: Great Mexican food at a good price. Ordered a variety of authentic tacos and Mexican Coke. Service was great. I'll stop by next time I'm in the mood for tacos.

JBAPMZ87VU4nJ_gNDp-eMQ.text: I am brand new to the Charlotte area and decided to try this place out! The food was fresh and delicious. I had 3 different tacos-steak, pork, and chicken. All wonderful! It's extremely authentic and the staff is friendly! I was very pleased and will definitely be back again :)

bkTfs4Fih0BaWSiFBFOwBw.text: Absolutely delicious!  If you are looking for great tacos, do yourself a favor and stop in.

gVExVaD7YxFRNC1fsBdXmA.text: They have mexican soda so that's a plus. The good is cheap and the portions are huge. The only real problem I had was being ignored for almost 45 minutes. We were almost done eating by the time we were asked of the food was good. We wanted to order another drink but the sever never came back until 15 minutes after we were done eating. It seemed like she was avoiding us, cleaning the tables around us and not bothering to check on is despite our attempts to look pathetic and needy.

IYgfofrD24LCaKr5cCAWhg.text: Finally! My boyfriend and I have been looking for authentic Mexican  (Honduran) food in the Charlotte area since we moved here 7 months ago. It is a hole-in-the-wall kind of place with a small but very friendly staff. The flavors are spot on. Their tomatillo salsa is perfect, the chorizo tacos were amazing. I was starting to think there weren't any authentic places in the area, so thank you, Tacos El Nevado!!

KmgS9g6vd9eQNVT6c-54vg.text: I'm Latina and recently moved to Charlotte. Tacos El Nevado has really good tacos.  The place isn't at all fancy and you'll only see a few people in there, but the tacos are delicious.  Try their horchata too!    La comida esta sabrosa!

vZeHSCarHNDiwhQCEUL1eg.text: The address for this location (South Blvd) is correct but the map is not, and it isn't near the Eastland neighborhood listed.  The food was excellent, and my girlfriend and I really enjoyed our visit. We tried tacos of pastor (pork), chicken, asada (steak), and barbacoa. I wouldn't recommend the barbacoa, but all 3 of the others were simply awesome. The restaurant offers three side salsas, but the tacos were so tasty that we didn't really try them for more than a bite or two. I also ordered the torta albanileras, and it might've been even better than the tacos. The bread was super soft, and all the sandwich toppings went together really well and were high quality.  There are servers, but it almost felt like a hybrid between waiter service and takeout because you have to pay at the counter on your own and a few different servers brought out the food and checked on us.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pollo taco

Rdkra7mryhpXhv_HIAtQfA.text: Tacos El Nevado will likely be one of the more borderline Authentic Mexican places you find around Charlotte, the vibe is very kitschy and mostly everything on the walls and playing on the tvs will not be in English, so don't expect chain store tex-mex. If authentic isn't your thing, know the food, the prices, as well as the portions make up for anything that may get lost in those departments.  A few things to note:   * We read in another review that they gave you 3 kinds of salsa, but then charged you for chips. We did not have this happen to us, but admittedly, we got one round of chips and didn't get offered more, but we also weren't charged for them. You do get 3 kinds of salsa.  * The language barrier (could) be mildly problematic. My wife asked if she could have charro beans rather than refried, and there was no way the waitress was going to understand the concept of 'substitution'. After a few rounds of trying to explain, we just gave up and got the refried. Although she did come back and ask if we wanted a small portion or charro beans on the side, so that was nice. Also upon walking in we asked if we could sit at a corner booth, and we were simply told "no." We later noticed it was because someone was sitting there, but either way, it seemed abrupt. But again, after the person left, we were asked if we wanted to move there. So, even though that barrier was tough to breach, the employees were still very helpful, although a bit distant at times.  * The waitress (likely) won't take your credit card up after dropping your check off at the table - you go up and pay at the window. For a new visitor, you may sit there for a long time wondering why your bill hasn't moved, this is why.   * The portions are very large for the price. I got a fajita beef burrito (huge), with a side of charro beans and my wife for the beef fajitas, plus chips and salsa, along with an extra steak that just randomly showed up at the table. (We didn't pay anything for it and we were told it was just 'extra'...we still don't know if that came due to a language barrier or the fact that my wife's fajitas seemed a bit scarce on the steak) either way a nice bonus. The total bill for an entire table of food was a bit over $22, and there was another full meal of leftovers. If we went back, we would get tacos, at $2 each you could try a lot for very little.  Overall, I would recommend trying it out, the language barrier is there, but shouldn't be a deterrent, and possibly getting something a bit more out of your comfort zone if you want a more full experience. You'll likely be more satisfied with an authentic tripe or carnitas street taco here than you will be getting a more common option like a cheese quesadilla.

uYBrl-1dxkujpcN5kcfY_w.text: good food, qiuck service,only thing negative is sodas come in a bottle so refills are not free!!!  otherwise very good food!!  authentic mexican cooks are always a plus!!!  i would recommend it!  the chicken flautas are amazing!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States

_uBXC7GnGm_FatfllEnoXw.text: The best Mexican food I've ever had.  This place is 4.5 stars for a reason...and that is because some people who shouldn't be writing reviews gave them a bad rating bc they didn't like their waitress.  Give this place a shot...i love their (something) hambre. Homemade corn tortillas. Great house made salsas and a real authentic vibe.

t9AJcxsrSexRSXwCN_BLLg.text: I love this location although anyone hardly speaks english! VERY AUTHENTIC TACOS ! " MEXICAN FOOD "

gGepR9G1D37lijC_wcyI4A.text: I have reached Nirvana with the delicious tacos here!  Let me be honest, this place looks a little rough on the outside, but oh my gosh, is it a gem on the inside.   I have tried a lot of places in Charlotte, but this little gen opens up when you walk in. I love that when I visited here l, the place was packed wall to wall with native Spanish speaking families.   If the natives love a place, you can be sure, you will too.   I am marking this as one of my favorite places to eat!  Yummmm!!!

wHidBCV8kyHiBPl-JCGjng.text: Definitely on my top list for tacos ever. I was here on business for three days and ate here for three days in a row. The avocado sauce blew my mind. The beef tongue was okay. It needed more flavor. I had better. But all the other tacos were all delicious.

6jYoO7p9fDPwfe4nS96Fag.text: Let's talk about Tacos El Nevado! This restaurant leaves so much to be desired.. First and foremost it's the first Mexican restaurant I've ever been to in my entire life that brings you 3 different kinds of dipping sauce but doesn't provide chips. The best thing about this place was their avocado sauce which swayed us to buy an order of chips in order to have something to eat the sauce with. Turns out they were extremely stale. ;-( We also ordered their menudo which was actually very good, and their steak tacos which tasted a bit off. The worst part of this experience was the waitress, she was extremely rude, made us wait forever, barely checked in on us and the few times she did approach us walked away before we could even tell her what we needed. Would Definitely suggest passing on this place!

V3X2bUvuBrIAqailLgkeuw.text: First good sign as you walk in, 95% of the patrons are of Hispanic descent.  Then you look at the menu and realize it's not your "typical Mexican restaurant," followed by the actual food which is very authentic and delicious.  The prices are also amazing. Just a win.

MWrE23nC56GRMqWA82RMCg.text: I was craving authentic Mexican food and unfortunately this is not the spot for it. The guacamole was basically half cilantro. My burrito was filled with burnt cheese and the rice had green beans in it. I will never go back here.

jsOnrE2MnIMz_jQ8H_sE-w.text: Just moved to Charlotte area from New England and was looking for some good Mexican food. The only reason I'm giving this four stars is because I don't think they have a full bar, and I do like getting a Paloma and/or a margarita when I go to Mexican restaurants. The food was amazing and authentic. The staff very friendly. Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States

3wWq2QODwi8LiTg1lm-FWw.text: Simply Awesome.  Authentic and tasty.  Great little hole in the wall, furniture was cool, they diddn't speak english really; but we were able to get exactly what we ordered.  We had Carne Asada; very good.  The chips and salsa: freshly cooked chips; sauces were fresh; tomatillo sauce was great.  Gave us a piece of Cactus to eat with the Carne; complimented it well.  Bean soup was great.  Everything seemed very fresh and tasted amazing; good prices!

Ac2ajweKvsOVm-TIGGJ09A.text: This place is one of the most authentic Mexican restaurants we've been to in Charlotte! Everything from the tacos, sopes, gorditas, sauces and drinks were tasty! I'm taking away one star because they don't offer chips! First restaurant I've been to that doesn't have chips!!!

fOPiLz233N9HkIFXc5IBJA.text: This is probably the best tacosI have eaten and I usually go to the central avenue location. Unfortunately, this last experience was horrible. Lets start with that my manager went to the one in east blvd. WHAT A HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE for him. He was kind enough to buy us lunch and he asked us to choose so he place for him to pick up the food, so I choose this place becasue I love the food. My manager came back an hour later (we're only 5 minutes away) and said the service there was horrible and he felt uncomfortable on how he was treated. Yes he does not speak spanish, but the waiters should not be giving him a hard time. he said the ladies kept rolling their eyes and making bad gestures when he was asking for information. Ontop of taking one hour to make the food and he was waiting there patiently, that was very uncalled for. I usually never write bad reviews but I am very dissapointed at this restaurant. We work at a doctors office and we would not treat our patients on how he was treated there. I give this place a one star becasue of this. yes your food is amazing, but if the service is horrible then it makes customers not want to come back. Not coming back again. And I highly recommend people going to the one in central ave.

B99RGupduOYb-lVtAp-JAw.text: Not sure why people say this is a whole in the wall. Its a fairly noce, and very traditionally decorated mexican restaurant. Good food. The gordita shells are a bit thin. Their chicken is amazing. I would rate a 4.5,  i have eatin at many mexican restaurants tho and am very picky.   Also their burrito is good as well. There are green beans and peas in it which i havent seen before and is a little odd.

4vARG8L-KjZKYj0UT4T-Iw.text: Almost always a pleasure to dine here. It is hole in the wall. There are two locations but I find this one to have a juicier al pastor. Queso is average but still it's white queso so I'm gonna dunk all da tings in it. The tacos al pastor is king here and the tortillas are made in house and so so good. And the cebollitas and hot peppers are great accoutrements. Don't expect this to be a hot date night place unless you are over the frills. Not much ambiance or cocktails.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tacos al pastor with everything.
Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States

uE6TKJ-ND_4pD2PAaPdZjg.text: Best food I have had in quite a long time. I love this place!! Had the canitas and a gordito with chicken. Washed it all down with a bottle of very cold Mexican coke.

dCLgoFWfEodkRAM5IzHrTw.text: Awesome tacos. Carne asada - very good. Al pastor good. They bring you 3 salsas to the table and no chips - you have to order those separately. Overall good place for tacos. Didn't try other things but they looked kind of average.

FiX619ZQZDOG9IJ3pQkq7w.text: Best tacos ever!!!  Beef tongue was incredible as was barbacoa!!  I had been told there was great Mexican food in charlotte but this place certainly proved it!

stL8RoEdB7XfdWd6CtGjqw.text: All I can tell you is wow must try so far best tacos I've had in Charlotte. PS if I can rate 10 stars I will

jeY_wAibYFWWx_H9gEcQ8Q.text: I review food, not environment.  Tacos-amazing. Home made tortillas, full flavor, the taste was just as if I was back in Chicago eating street food. Their mole sauce was authentic and chips were freshly made in-house. THUMBS UP! Don't let the lack of reviews throw you off from going here-it's real authentic Mexican.

b2X0orsQ8s6g5nUf-MKp1g.text: Best authentic Mexican food in town!  Love the barbacoa tacos at $2 a piece. Wonderful friendly service. My husband and I have been here many times and have never been disappointed.

_KV6fo3CdK2amWd2fkrXDQ.text: After four years in Chicago, I was seriously jones'ing for a simple platter of "carne y tres" -style Mexican food, 'cause who can argue with a great "meat and three" lunch of protein, beans, rice and cheese!  (And before you say, "But, there are amazing Mexican restaurants in Chicago!", just remember not all Chicago neighborhoods are the same - and there's no decent, affordable "homestyle Mexican" in the downtown area - just Rick Bayless' empire of over-hyped Mexican joints serving $55 a plate micro-portions of grilled steak with four artfully arranged black beans)   While our friends dove into classic burritos, like the $7.50 Fajita Burrito, and the mountainous Pollo Asado ($7.99), I caved in and ordered my favorite combination; the Coctel de Camarones (Shrimp Cocktail) was enormous, and perfectly flavored with onion, lime, cilantro and that classic thick, ketchup-based sauce. The shrimp were perfectly poached and the generous topping of avocado made the entire bowl creamy. The $2.25 Lengua Tacos (beef tongue) were outrageously tender and smoky, and with a healthy dollop of their avocado sauce, a perfect match with the cool cocktail. The sweet radishes were a nice touch - very seasonal and they added a nice crunch to the soft-shelled taco.  True "meat and three" dining! Lucky for the folks living and visiting Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States. $2.25 Lengua Tacos, with grilled onion and sweet, candy-like radishes.
Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States. Perfect Coctel de Camarones! Classic Saturday morning hangover helper!

4ZigudAN8BJwOxEMTxva0Q.text: This place was delicious!!!! First time in, was doing work in the area. Glad I chose this spot! The food was amazing and authentic! Just moved from San Diego, so a bit spoiled being so close to the source the last few years.   The service was great, quick, attentive. She wanted to make sure everything came out as perfect as possible.   I just put together some make-shift vegetarian tacos with beans, rice, avocado, pineapple, jalepenos, and a plate of toppings to add!! The avocado salsa was really good!   Neat spot! Great patio when weather permitting, and neat colorf inside! Will have to come back for margaritas!! Was even slightly busy between lunch and dinner time. Good sign ;)  Thanks, keep it up!!

-7cvfy9DyUgbTGcGov22-w.text: Absolutely Amazing!!!! Best Mexican food I have ever had.  Will definitely visit again when we are in the area.

9A3_eIyL5uR--zX6I3mybA.text: This is by far the best Mexican Restaurant we have been too! Waitress was friendly, food was out of this world good!! Next time thru we will be back

zgiWKXJ-8ZvwMQFIhsJs0w.text: Tacos El Nevado is a great dive for a quick Authentic Mexican lunch!  The steak tacos are absolutely fantastic!!  The restaurant isn't much to look at, but the staff is friendly, and the food is spot on.  Definitely a great lunch spot!!!

Ttk-soRXlF6owEZJoV6L1w.text: Love the seating. Great place to go for Tlyudas! The carne asada is also wonderful. This is real Mexican food not Mexican American so if you're looking for chips and salsa this ain't the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States

oSwuK4uLPbJi94ImCSDQUw.text: It's always a good sign when you see Mexicans eating at a Mexican restaurant. Or at least we thought. From the outside it doesn't look very promising, but it's rather roomy inside and very colorful and lively. The servers are nice, lacking some attention to detail, but you can't have it all.  The food was pretty basic, nothing spectacular or worthy of a second visit. The Horchata was watered down and they don't give you chips, which was very strange.   The prices were fair but so was the food, I won't return.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States. Horchata was watery, and we told the waitress multiple times, NO ICE!
Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Enchiladas
Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tacos were just o.k. More cilantro than meat

kcXfj46Ap2H2_30ngRHwyg.text: Asada steak taco is amazing. The queso is great, chips excellent: I will definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States

nU4Qt90GKv9DNpG6ji2xfQ.text: The food was delicious and the salsas top notch. The restaurant, however, was too cramped and cold. Next time, I will get takeout.

7LQajNGq6kE2BWBpKFTS_Q.text: I've been taking adventurous diners here for years and they always leave impressed. Don't let the exterior fool ya, the dishes are made with love and always satisfy the palette. You'll need to ask for tortilla chips if you want. My go-to is the huaraches with el pastor and a michelada to wash it down. You won't leave disappointed.

7f4P0mZaKzOSdmjjnY0T_w.text: GREAT place for tacos! VERY authentic homemade tortillas and chips. We were the only white people in the restaurant, which means that it caters well to the Hispanic community. We loved it!

FMjQJXToYgtczaW8VRzmpg.text: I love love love their tacos!! Just like the one off the street carts they have lots of flavor and inexpensive and the ladies are great in there

omCsHPTSAvUOba6hckO0fA.text: This is my favorite authentic style taco place that I've been to so far in Charlotte. Everything on the menu looked really good, but we felt obligated to get tacos on our first visit. We tried most of the tacos: chorizo, al pastor, asada, carnitas, barbacoa, and a beef/pork. All of them were delicious, but our favorites were the beef/pork, chorizo, and barbacoa. The service was really fast and very friendly. They also give you three different dipping sauces with chips. The sauces were really good on the tacos as well. We will definitely be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tacos: pork/beef, chorizo, barbacoa, adada, carnitas, al pastor

Axt7qEh4PE_eTmlt7hrRPw.text: Came here for lunch with some colleagues and got the $2 tacos. They were out of this world! I haven't gotten Mexican food this good and authentic since I've been in Mexico! Highly recommended to any Mexican food lover, you won't be disappointed!

MtjYLAbGpB24nc_54ZWpBg.text: Treated me bad. If u not Spanish don't go!!! Served old chicken. I should not have eaten the food since no one gave me eye contact. Talking to each other then looking at me.

rSAKk2nT5gBpEfWcrUWfHA.text: The bombest tacos in Charlotte for $2 EVERY DAY. All the white people here complain that there aren't enough taco places in town because they aren't in familiar areas like down East Blvd or on E Bland....Hello, there are plenty of Mexican restaurants...You just have to go to Mexican neighborhoods.   Seeing boring white people get excited about $2 taco Tuesday at a white owned tex-mex chain is disappointing when there is an independent restaurant a little further away, making their own tortillas, and charging $2 consistently- for a far superior tasting product.   Come here, get several of the tacos al pastor and some queso and chips.  We make it out of here spending $27 pre-tip getting 8 tacos, queso and chips, a Mexican coke, and an extra side of cebollitas and chiles....like a pair of pot-bellies bandits.  Service is usually a miss but who gives a shit? There is sometimes a language barrier and I've never been to Mexico so I don't know if they're friendly at their taquerias to customers, anyway.  Seat yourself and make sure to go up to the register and pay after you're done. Ask for an itemized check, because they won't give you one.

5iRyKL4zY-3wSYrX5hB4UA.text: This place is awesome. It's a hidden gem that I really don't want to tell y'all about. But we're talking about great food at great prices. Not Tex mex. El Nevado is more authentic Mexican. Tacos, tortas, and other stuff that I don't know. I had two carnitas tacos and two carne asada gorditas. Tacos were really good. Gorditas were killer (really, get the gorditas!!!). The green sauce has a little kick, the red sauce has a lot of heat, and the onion slaw is good and cool. It's a small place, so even if the parking lot isn't packed the inside will be pretty full. A lot of people were ordering the horchata, so it must be good, but I opted for a Modelo.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States. Modelo and radish always helps cool down the tacos and gorditas
Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States. Be careful with the salsa roja!
Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gordita con Carne Asada!

92Sgs1FEBN1i5qlTZPytKA.text: This place has the best tacos in the world. These tacos are authentic and taste delicious. Brush up on your Espanol because very few of the waitresses know English or know it well. Which makes the experience even better. The quac is incredible. Also, they bring sauces to the table, a brown sauce, an avocado sauce and verde salsa. All are delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheese dip and chips
Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States. Three sauces. Verde salsa, avocado sauce and a brown sauce.
Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States. Everything minus the guacamole!

bFmVQT99WByiiPHpoLlbBA.text: Serendipity situation - stopped in to get some Horchata and the waitress was selling me hard on their tacos. Their horchata was amazing by the way. Took the bait and ordered a set of four carne asada tacos. Why not. Let's give it a try. Very good move. These weren't average at all, they were True authentic Mexican style tacos with juicy seasoned meat and soft warm flour tortillas. I knew it was a good play when every customer sitting in the restaurant was of Mexican descent and at every table, they had plates of tacos. Always quick scan your surroundings, that's key. Shoot, the name of the restaurant is Tacos El Nevado. I couldn't just come in and get an Horchata drink (which was still big time by the way, second shoutout) without showing respect and trying their tacos. Great quality meat with chopped onions, cilantro, and radish & lime on the side. That's the real Mexican taco way. This place did it right and checked all the boxes. Priced at about $2 a taco with good serving sizes of meat, it's a winner. Unsure if they do the deal here, but guess where I'll be at on Tuesday's. You know what time it is - it's TACO TUESDAY.  Sometimes simplicity is all it takes. Meat, cheese, and tortilla came through with a POW. Ordered a quesadilla to accompany my main course of tacos and it was well worth it. You don't need to get too crazy with quesadillas, and the good ones are packed with lots of meat without being overpowered by the cheese. Beef was far from dry and contained that Mexican grill flavor. Didn't even need to sauce this dilla up. The cheese pulled away gently and didn't stick on hard, which is critical when you're chewing. This allowed the steak to be the aggressive scorer, while the cheese comfortably sat back being a role player, delivering with big time assists. Another perfect pairing with my tacos to a successful dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak Quesadilla.
Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carne Asada Tacos.

ji5Bb5kjCtjk7bl9XukFtg.text: As a Mexican and a passionate cook, I am always looking for the real deal and, this place is one of them. No wonder why they have some Best of the Best awards from Charlotte's magazine. Everything in the menu is great and authentic. Every time I come here my first choice is to have the special of the day because is fast, incredible fresh and inexpensive. Service is always cheerful and friendly. It is a super relax atmosphere full of Mexicans, like me, looking for a traditional comfort food, well prepared, using authentic ingredients.  This time I had the Enfrijoladas. Enfrijoladas: Made from scratch warm tortilla folded in half, smothered in a herb infused black bean sauce topped with Oaxaca and cotija cheeses and Mexican cream. Delightful! There is nothing more Mexican than that!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mexican Sodas
Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZaeBD9m9Fq0aUO8VNcSD1A.text: 4.5  stars  Great dinner at this small restaurant. A Truly hidden gem, authentic homemade Mexican food.  Be aware it will be fully crowded during weekends.   So, I decided to go with my friend on a Monday night. There were 3 tables and ours. Love the seating.  The place is very colorful gives you good vibes. From the outside you can smell the food...I'm so happy I chose this spot.   Amazing and Authentic food! It taste so good! We couldn't believe how flavorful was the rice, beans, everything.  Our server Cindy, came with chips already made. They were hot! With 3 different kind of salsas.  Service was great, very attentive, knowledgeable and kind. All ladies around we're checking on us.  My friend got a Margarita, it was so cool!   For less than $10, a huge one and good. (other places are too small or with poor tequila)  Homemade tortillas. I got "the hungry killer with salad" Portions are BIG. The meat was so tender and flavorful.   My friend went with "3 Mexican Tacos". No leftovers for her. Stated it was delicious and full of flavor.   Tacos are $2 EVERY DAY!!! Really once again food inexpensive and delicious.  Only cons are drinks comes in bottles or cans, so no refill. And we hated the restroom was so dirty. That's why I'm only giving a 4.5 stars.  If you are looking just for child and salsa, or a fancy trendy mediocre Tex-Mex place. This is not the place for you.   Definitely my new favorite Mexican restaurant. After being living in Charlotte for 3 years and a half I found it!   Other things to note: * You go up and pay to the window. * If you only speak English, make sure what you are going to order. (anyone hardly speaks English inside). However, menu is available in Spanish and English. * Portions are large for the size. * Remember there are no refills. * Even there will be enough space in the parking lot, inside will be full. (You can always choose different days or hours.) *Check appetizers, guacamole, alcoholic and none alcohol drinks like: American sodas (coke-pepsi) with waitress (they are not in the menu). * Address is correct (South blvd) but not the map. (make sure if you are not familiar with the area). * Dont mind about the 1 star's reviews. Probably they only went once and was for sure something out of the menu. * if you like/love Mexican food, this is a MUST!  Hands down! Be back soon for Tacos!!

y4n3-iIU_eK0RZrtPnU4Rg.text: Careful this place is now charging 4% if you use a credit card.  However this is not adequately advertised and according to the law the amount a merchant can charge for credit card transaction must be the lowest of the fee charges by the credit card or 4%.  I invited a large group for dinner and was surprised that this place now charges 4%.  I love this restaurant (but si mainly go to the one in Central where they do not charge for use of credit card).   If this place doesn't add a clear sign indicating they have a 4% credit card surcharge I will stop coming here.

A2fYPTbI_xUbQMMo_cpxqQ.text: Great authentic tacos and always $2!! The inside is very colorful and the staff was friendly and very attentive.

cytMXFC7ibweUpNFQHo5Lg.text: Always great! I normally stick to old faithful and order the tacos but I must say these are the best tacos! Go ... if only for the tacos

7t555gn0lqEIx56h9wakBA.text: I heard it was the best place to get authentic tacos and they were right. You have to get the pineapple soda when you go! The $2 tacos can't be beat

hd2ZRau7X157YT56bMk7Rw.text: Great Mexican food , raised in Cali I know Mexican and this place is authentic , fresh and tasty. Try the chicharron tacos yum!

wW1YQoDKsehhiiS1rWRijg.text: Authentic Mexican food?  Check.  Inexpensive?  Check.  Great Mexican atmosphere?  Check.( I was the only gringo there lol).  Tasty beautiful food?  Check.  You just won me over Tacos El Nevado.  I will definitely come back for your Menudo!  Love it, love it.

WnMN7qsvJ1-WNGtYwIuvEA.text: Service was speedy and food was fresh and bursting with flavor! Chicken and steak were both well-seasoned and juicy but our favorite was the steak! Hard to find a mexican place up to this standard in Clt!

x_1iSL6eQmFUwvYhg5sOzQ.text: Based on the Yelp reviews, I decided to give this place a try. It was well worth it! Delicious authentic Mexican flavor and vibe, and everything was very reasonably priced. I ordered the "Hungry Killer" and it lived up to the name. Tons of flavor and a large portion plus the corn tortillas made it perfection. This is a wonderful low key place to relax and enjoy delicious food and cerveza. Don't let the building fool you, this is Grade A cuisine.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hungry Killer - this meal is AMAZING!!!

4zpfNoXD3eJtwAAlZvlvqg.text: Definitely not the best authentic Mexican restaurant. Food was so so. I would not drive out of the way to eat it again. Way more options in the area.

mSe4NGQySG0AKqTGUNYn2Q.text: Can't say this was my preferred Mexican food.   You walk in and you seat yourself. They only serve beer for alcohol. You're provided with three salsas but not chips.  We preferred cokes and cheese dip. The cokes were in bottles and Mexican cokes and so yummy. The cheese dip was watered down but good. They only provide a small amount of chips. We ran out before half way done with the dip.  I ordered a beef burrito and rice and beans. Sadly, I did not like any of the above. The beans were runny, the rice had some dehydrated and dehydrated peas. The beef burrito had very crispy beef bits that I didn't love.  My boyfriend ordered the beef fajita burrito and really liked it.  The food proportions were large and service was nice. It was not busy on a Friday night.

nHgO7E8DbcpYRvDVZf55Kg.text: Taste sooooo good! Its amazing overall you should come try it. Great environment and nice people

Wy5eYg8BnKG8yrGrc9pzfw.text: It's really hard to find real authentic Mexican food . This place is amazing definitely recommend this to anyone

zn-nTUvy8oBSqdE892C4tg.text: The most authentic Mexican food in Charlotte.  Coming from San Diego I was on a serious mission to find Mexican food!  This is the real deal.  The tortillas are authentic and the care asada is delicious.

_cCzs32ebokuhpO3l8f5fg.text: Looking for True Mexican food in Charlotte is like tip toeing through a minefield. For the most part you get a lot of Americanized Mexican food that's is claimed to be "authentic". This place is not only authentic but tastes like home. The food was delicious, waitresses were friendly, and the restaurant was very clean and inviting.

Z0ZFjBRtuz2nAhL--1pXdw.text: Great late lunch at this small restaurant that is on South Boulevard, or as it sometimes gets called "Burrito Way" for all the Latin American restaurants that dot the few miles between Woodland and down to the 485 intersection. Some are better than others and Tacos El Nevado would be one of the better ones.  It's a small place, not very extensively decorated and it was surprisingly full when I arrived close to 3pm. I was brought to a table and my order taken. About five minutes later, it was served.  Three delicious tacos topped with cilantro and onions. Attractively plated with a big piece of lime and several radish slices. One beef, one chorizo and one pollo, they were excellent. Lots of meat on here, the flour tortillas held together well. The meat was tasty if perhaps a little bit small pieces.  Very inexpensive. Three tacos with a Mexican soda and tip, just over $10.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tacos El Nevado in Charlotte, NC
Photo of Tacos El Nevado - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tacos El Nevado in Charlotte, NC

BvR8tJXBuFwcTIQUeXs_0Q.text: I have been going here for about 2 years now & never had a complaint. The food is always good and the service WAS great. But I'm sad to say things have changed. Went to eat with my family and we waited for about 5 mins before we got seated. Our waiter came to take our drinks & order, I'd say the food arrived fairly quick. No complaints on the food expect that they do give ONE slice of lime for 5 tacos. Our waiter left & never came back to check on us, no one did. There was waiters asking other tables but not us... anyway we asked a random waiter for more lime & were told "just a second" & never received it. My husband had to go up to the register to ask for it. It's understanding when the restaurant is full but that wasn't the case. Probably will be ordering take out instead of dine in.

qlJHbZY0RV3CoKpENx94eg.text: I just ate here for the second time. The first time I had the enchiladas, which weren't all that memorable. This time I had a gordita and two tacos. The gordita was delicious, and the taco al pastor was the best I've had in Charlotte. I want to come back and try more tacos and the tlayuda. My only complaint is that they didn't serve chips.
